line.token: * This file is part of the Symfony package.

// exec is mandatory here since we send a signal to the process
// this code will result in a maximum of 2 reads of 8192 bytes by calling
// start() and isRunning(). by the time getOutput() is called the process
// has terminated so the internal pipes array is already empty. normally
// the call to start() will not read any data as the process will not have
// generated output, but this is non-deterministic so we must count it as
// a possibility. therefore we need 2 * PipesInterface::CHUNK_SIZE plus
// another byte which will never be read.
// Let's wait enough time for process to finish...
// Here we don't call Process::run or Process::wait to avoid any read of pipes
'Process execution did not complete in the required time frame'
'This test fails with a timeout on Windows, can someone investigate please?'
'Input can not be set while the process is running.'
* @expectedExceptionMessage Symfony\Component\Process\Process::setInput only accepts strings or stream resources.
'The callback should be executed with the output'
// use a lock file to toggle between writing ("W") and reading ("R") the
// use a lock file to toggle between writing ("W") and reading ("R") the
// use a lock file to toggle between writing ("W") and reading ("R") the
// use a lock file to toggle between writing ("W") and reading ("R") the
'Windows does not support POSIX exit code'
// such command run in bash return an exitcode 127
'This test is for Windows platform only'
'TTY mode is not supported on Windows platform.'
'PTY is not supported on this operating system.'
// SIGTERM is only defined if pcntl extension is present
'The process has been signaled with signal "9".'
// Ensure that both processed finished and the output is numeric
// Ensure that restart returned a new process by check that the output is different
// Windows is a bit slower as it read file handles, then allow twice the precision
'This test fails with a timeout on Windows, can someone investigate please?'
'POSIX signals do not work on Windows'
'POSIX signals do not work on Windows'
'Disabling output while the process is running is not possible.'
'Enabling output while the process is running is not possible.'
'Output can not be disabled while an idle timeout is set.'
'Idle timeout can not be set while the output is disabled.'
'Output has been disabled, enable it to allow the use of a callback.'
'Output has been disabled, enable it to allow the use of a callback.'
'Output has been disabled, enable it to allow the use of a callback.'
// Avoid XL buffers on Windows because of https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=65650
* provides default method names for simple getter/setter.
